terms.definition: Sovereign intelligence and enforcement layer governing reasoning, routing, and execution safety across all Pearl & Pig systems. GARVIS enforces truth but does not approve decisions.
Systems-first creative IP studio and sole owner of the GARVIS architecture and its constituent systems.
Enterprise Creative Operating System - A tenant-safe, white-label deployment pattern powered by GARVIS. Enterprises own their knowledge bases and outputs; Pearl & Pig retains system ownership.
Authoritative authorship, provenance, and rights registry. Nothing is real, licensable, or defensible unless registered in Telauthorium.
Creative and operational law governing phase discipline, proof gates, and completion logic from SPARK through SUNSET.
Multi-Operator Systems Engine - Orchestration engine that routes work through Pig Pen operators under GARVIS enforcement and Flightpath constraints.
Trusted Efficiency Liaison Assistant - Execution layer that converts authorized intent into real-world action through constrained adapters.
Frozen registry of non-human cognition operators (TAI-D) used for analysis, flags, and recommendations. Pig Pen operators never approve decisions.
User Overlay Layer - Permissioned, advisory customization layer allowing user perspectives, goals, and role-based visibility without altering system authority.
Telauthorium ID - Immutable identity assigned to every object (idea, decision, artifact, output, deal, report, execution event).
Telauthorium Authority ID - Immutable identifier representing a real human authority. All accountability resolves to a TAID.
Telauthorium AI-D - Identifier assigned to a non-human Pig Pen operator. TAI-Ds have cognition authority only.
Telauthorium Sovereign ID - Non-delegable sovereign authority identifier held by the Founder/Architect.
User Overlay ID - Identifier for a specific user overlay pack applied at runtime.
Ordered sequence of Pig Pen operator consults produced by MOSE prior to execution.
Ledger-recorded action performed by TELA.
Ledger-recorded resolution made by a human TAID.
Ledger-recorded block, halt, or constraint trigger.
System state indicating execution is illegal or unsafe to proceed.
System state indicating execution is legal but requires human judgment before proceeding.
A scoped, time-bound grant of access to GARVIS-powered capabilities. Ownership is never transferred.
License granting access to a specific system component (e.g., Telauthorium) under defined constraints.
Sandboxed, white-label deployment governed by Pearl & Pig with strict architectural isolation.
Document version control requiring founder authorization for any changes, with version numbering and published delta logs.
Initial ideation phase in the Flightpath COS lifecycle.
Development and construction phase in the Flightpath COS lifecycle.
Release and deployment phase in the Flightpath COS lifecycle.
Growth and scaling phase in the Flightpath COS lifecycle.
Ongoing maintenance and evolution phase in the Flightpath COS lifecycle.
End-of-life and deprecation phase in the Flightpath COS lifecycle.

components.name: SOVEREIGN AUTHORITY
components.description: TSID-0001 Founder / Architect - Constitutional authority, final arbitration, versioning & canon control

components.name: TELAUTHORIUM
components.description: Authorship, Provenance, Rights Registry - TID/TAID/TAI-D enforcement, rights clarity & licensing state

components.name: GARVIS
components.description: Sovereign Intelligence & Enforcement - Truth enforcement, drift & risk detection

components.name: FLIGHTPATH COS
components.description: Creative Law & Phase Discipline - SPARK → BUILD → LAUNCH → EXPAND → EVERGREEN → SUNSET

components.name: MOSE
components.description: Multi-Operator Systems Engine - Operator routing & sequencing, escalation & conflict resolution

components.name: PIG PEN
components.description: Non-Human Cognition Operators (TAI-D) - Analysis, flags, recommendations (no approval authority)

components.name: TELA
components.description: Trusted Efficiency Liaison Assistant - Executes approved actions through adapter-based tooling

components.name: AUDIT & EVENT LEDGER
components.description: Immutable, Append-Only Truth Record - Records decisions, routing, enforcement, execution

response_data.response:
GARVIS is the sovereign intelligence and enforcement layer in the GoGarvis full‑stack architecture.

It sits below **Telauthorium** (authorship/provenance/rights authority) and above execution/orchestration layers, and its job is to:

- **Interpret and enforce sovereign authority**: ensure actions, permissions, and decisions comply with the authority chain (SOVEREIGN AUTHORITY → TELAUTHORIUM → GARVIS → …).
- **Gate and govern system behavior**: validate that requests, workflows, and outputs are permitted given provenance, rights, identity, and phase rules.
- **Coordinate policy across the stack**: translate Telauthorium registrations (TIDs/TAIDs/TAI‑Ds/TSID) into enforceable constraints for Flightpath COS and downstream routing.
- **Prevent unauthorized override**: components below GARVIS (Flightpath COS, MOSE, Pig Pen, TELA) cannot supersede constraints established above it.

GARVIS does not “execute” work itself—**execution happens at TELA**—but GARVIS determines what is allowed to be executed and under what conditions.
